item.title: Projects
item.description: R2P2 Our work on ZygOS and TCP revealed the mismatch between TCP's streaming semantics and RPCs’ message-oriented semantics. R2P2 (Request Response Pair Protocol) is a transport protocol specifically designed for datacenter RPCs. It exposes a request and response abstraction, as opposed to streams or messages, and allows for in-network policy enforcement based on software and hardware middleboxes. We explored several RPC policies on top of R2P2 such as fault-tolerance in HovercRaft and SLO-aware admission control in SVEN.
